page.title: 06MORE FARMING
page.content: Third landuse is that of hill ground, unploughable, useful only for grazing sheep and a small number of cattle. The main farm is Borlum House which runs out of the area to the south and is only sheep grazing. A very good hill sheep farm but economics of 1985 are declining hill sheep profitability and its future is uncertain. The bottom third of the map is poor hill ground with rock protruding in hill outcrops, mostly granitic. It is impossible to improve much of this ground by means of lime and phosphates as it is inaccessible to tractors and ariel application is to expensive for the returns possible. In 1985 we see a trend in land use towards afforestation aided by Government by tax concessions/direct grants towards tree planting. {M. Pottinger}
